entry.title: Re: Batch Jobs for processing Billing document request of...
entry.content:
SAP uses a two-step billing process for service contracts:

  • BDRs are created from billing request lines in the service contract.
  • Invoices are created from BDRs via the billing due list.

If BDRs are not being collected, it likely means they were not created yet.  Changing the billing type to F2 bypasses the BDR step and directly creates invoices, which is not ideal for service contracts.

Use the ‚ÄúSchedule Billing Document Request Creation‚Äù app to generate BDRs from service contracts. This job should run daily to ensure BDRs are created for all open billing request lines. Make sure the service contracts are in Released status. Refer to SAP Help  Billing of Service Transactions

Use the ‚ÄúCreate Billing Documents‚Äù app to convert BDRs into invoices. This job should also run daily, after the BDR creation job. Set the billing type to F2 (or your desired invoice type). Ensure that the BDRs are included in the billing due list.

 

Each billing request line in a service contract creates one BDR item, even if dates overlap.

If BDRs are missing, check the billing status in the service contract item‚Äôs billing plan section.

entry.title: Re: ePPDS resource cannot be deleted as only model-depend...
entry.content: Hi, yes...the problem is not the deletion, but the inconsistency, as the model-independent entry is missing. I opened an OSS towards SAP and got the solution: 2325595 - Resources in inactive planning version only - Solution Use report Z_RES_HARD_DEL to delete the resources from database. Implementation 1. Create report Z_RES_HARD_DEL using transaction SE38. 2. Paste source code that can be found in attachment Z_RES_HARD_DEL.txt 3. Define the following Text Symbols Symbol Text 001 Prepare 002 Select 003 Delete 004 Finish 005 Resources Found 006 Resources Deleted 007 Do you really want to delete the resources from the database? 008 Action cancelled 009 Entries from table /SAPAPO/RESKEY not deleted. 010 Simversion must be blank to delete /SAPAPO/RESKEY 4. Define the following Selection Texts Name Text P_TEST Test Mode SO_NAME Resource Name SO_GUID Resource GUID SO_VRSEX Simversion Name SO_VRSID Simversion GUID 5. Activate Make sure to maintain texts mentioned above for the logon language used by your user or use this report only in the language for which this report has been created in your system. The report requires entering a resource name or resource GUID. Initial parameters will be ignored, entering "*" is respected. When you enter one or multiple simversions, the resources only for those simversions will be deleted. If you want to delete the whole resource including the entry in database table /SAPAPO/RESKEY, simversion name and simversion GUID must be left blank. There is no consistency check. Selected resources will be deleted from database. Therefore, the report should only be used for inconsistent resources that cannot be deleted in any other way. Test mode is available. Warning: If you should want to use it for different approaches, please make sure, the entered resources are not in use anymore, before running the report. Otherwise the system will go into an inconsistent status that cannot be repaired anymore. Run liveCache consistency check for resources (detailed) after running the report.

entry.title: How to Join IDoc data (EDID4) with MSEG to Map REM Yield/Consumption to Planned Orders in SQVI?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm trying to create a custom report for our business user in SQVI to replicate the output of MB51, which I want to display the REM planned order number associated with each yield/consumption posting. Current challenge that I'm facing is that in REM, once the MES system sends data via IDoc, the postings are created in SAP against a cost collector (unlike discrete manufacturing whereby the postings will be against a production order).

My objective:

1. To build a report that mimics MB51 (based on MSEG + MKPF).

2. In the report each yield and consumption posting will be linked to each planned order.

3. The report also can be filtered by posting/entry dates.

 

I have done a bit of study and I've found that these tables below contains the information that I need in the report:

1. EDID4: Contains SData which includes the planned/work order, material, plant, etc.

2. EDIDC: Contains the timestamp of the IDoc

3. MSEG: Material document items

4. MKPF: For header data

 

So the challenge that I face:

1. The planned order number is available inside EDID4-SData as part of raw string.

2. There is no common fields that can link EDID4 with MSEG

3. SQVI does not support parsing SData, so I cannot extract the planned order field directly.

4. I have tried to join PLAF with MSEG + MKPF, however once I have generated the report, the planned order number is incorrectly mapped to each transaction. For example, even though I have filtered the transaction date as 30th July, there are old planned orders (May planned orders) and planned orders that yet to release (Dec 2025 planned orders) are displayed in the report. 

 

Is there any way to make this work in SQVI? Or is a custom ABAP/Z-table is the only viable path? Thanks in advance for your insights!

entry.title: Re: Automatic Reorder Point (MRP Type: V2 or VM) Planning - Part 2
entry.content:
Hello,

To answer the few queries please find the detailed explanation below.

Given: Historical Monthly Consumption

Month Consumption (units)

Jan 100
Feb 90
Mar 110
Apr 95
May 105
Jun 100
Total 600


Step 1: Calculate the Mean (Average)

Mean = (100 + 90 + 110 + 95 + 105 + 100) / 6 = 600 / 6 = 100


---

Step 2: Calculate Deviation from Mean for Each Month

Month Consumption Deviation (x - mean) Squared Deviation

Jan 100 0 0
Feb 90 -10 100
Mar 110 +10 100
Apr 95 -5 25
May 105 +5 25
Jun 100 0 0
Total = 250

 

---

Step 3: Calculate Variance

Since this is a sample (not population), we divide by (n - 1):

Variance = Total Squared Deviations / (n - 1)
= 250 / (6 - 1)
= 250 / 5 = 50


---

Step 4: Take Square Root of Variance ‚Üí Standard Deviation

Standard Deviation (œÉ) = ‚àö50 ‚âà 7.07 units/month


---

Step 5: Convert Monthly to Daily Std. Dev.

Assuming ~30 days per month:

œÉ_daily = 7.07 / ‚àö30 ‚âà 1.29 units/day

This daily standard deviation is what you‚Äôd use in the Safety Stock formula:

Safety Stock = Z √ó œÉ_daily √ó ‚àöLead Time
= 1.65 √ó 1.29 √ó ‚àö10
‚âà 1.65 √ó 1.29 √ó 3.16 ‚âà 6.71 units ‚Üí rounded to 7

Forecast Calculation (Constant Model)

Formula:

Forecast = Total Consumption / Number of Periods
= 600 / 6 = 100 units/month

To get daily consumption:

100 units / 30 days ‚âà 3.33 units/day

 

Please acknowledge if it is helpful for you...

 

Thanks 

Manoj

entry.title: Re: How to automatically assign a business role in BTP AB...
entry.content:
In target system - under User 

{
"condition": "$.groups[?(@.display=='IAS_GROUP_NAME')] empty false",
"constant": "BTP_ABAP_ROLE_NAME",
"optional": true,
"targetPath": "$.user.role[?(@.roleName=='BTP_ABAP_ROLE_NAME')].roleName"
}

you can repeat this for multiple Group to Role conditions

Thanks

Sreeni

entry.title: Re: SD Flexible Workflow
entry.content:
1) Yes you can have a full chain of multiple approvers. Each one is a step. The step can be defined as relevant only in circumstances. EG, Order value is over a set value. Any re-work or rejection will negate the previous approval and restart.

2) The current approver can be seen in the App Display Fact Sheet. 

Someone with more access could also find the current approver using the Gui via Trx SUIM but takes a number of clicks.

4) If the user has access to other other Apps, clicking the "order number" should give access to a customisable list of related apps. This should be the case wherever the starting point is.

entry.title: Re: Delete data from previous months after adding those t...
entry.content:
@Ganjos 

Better way of writing this logic would be as below. I did not see the use of your %SourceMonth% parameter in the code you provided.  What I understand is you are aggregating previous 11 months from target Date into Target data. Once aggregated you want to delete previous 11 months.

MEMBERSET [d/Date] =  PREVIOUS(11, "MONTH", %TargetMonth%) TO PREVIOUS(2, "MONTH", %TargetMonth%)
MEMBERSET [d/CP_DI_Origem] = ("Compromissos")

DATA([d/Date] = %TargetMonth%)=RESULTLOOKUP()

DELETE()

Hope this helps !!

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: Make custom fields mandatory
entry.content:
Hi,

 

you can set up validation rule for Fixed Asset master data via the App F6968 - Manage Substitution and Validation Rules - For Asset Master Data

You can create the validation (and substitution) rules for standard fields from the asset master record as well as for customer fields.

Please see the documentation about the features and usage here.

 

Regards,

Norbert

entry.title: How to use Cloud SDK for AI in an existing CAP NodeJS Project in CommonJS
entry.content:
I have an existing SAP Cloud Application Program Project in CommonJs. I want to add custom AI function in it . So need to use SAP Cloud SDK for AI in my project. But SAP Cloud SDK for AI only support native ESM.  Convert my existing project into ESM? I think it is too risky.  I need to use the ESM module in the CommonJs project.  At last, it works. Let me share the steps which maybe be helpful for you.

Steps:

1,  Install esbuild in the root path of my project:
npm i esbuild
2.  Create  folder named esm under  srv, then create a file named index.js under folder esm with the following code .
import { OrchestrationClient, buildAzureContentSafetyFilter } from '@sap-ai-sdk/orchestration';
import { AzureOpenAiEmbeddingClient } from '@sap-ai-sdk/langchain'

export { OrchestrationClient, buildAzureContentSafetyFilter, AzureOpenAiEmbeddingClient };
2.  Add following script in my package.json file in project root path.
 "deps": "esbuild --platform=node srv/esm/index.js --bundle --outfile=srv/esm/bundle.js"

3.  Run the following command in the project root path in terminal.
npm run deps

4.  Adjust the code of importing the module of SAP Cloud SDK for AI as the following.
// const { OrchestrationClient, buildAzureContentSafetyFilter } = require('@sap-ai-sdk/orchestration');
const { OrchestrationClient, buildAzureContentSafetyFilter } = require('../esm/bundle');
// const { AzureOpenAiEmbeddingClient } = require('@sap-ai-sdk/langchain');
const { AzureOpenAiEmbeddingClient } = require('../esm/bundle');

 

 

The ends!

Thanks for your time!

Jacky Liu

entry.title: Re: AR Aging Analysis in Account Receivable Overview
entry.content:
Hi @12345678901 

Thanks for reaching out.

I will walk you through how you can achieve your target for the following:

  • How to calculate the ‚ÄúNet Overdue‚Äù percentage in the AR Aging Analysis section
  • How to calculate the percentage of AR collected

 

How SAP Calculates the ‚ÄúNet Overdue‚Äù Percentage

You‚Äôre referring to the AR Aging Analysis tile, which shows a 15.7% Net Overdue for More Than Interval 1 Days. Below are steps required for the calculation:

  1. The first step is to Open the ‚ÄúAccounts Receivable Overview‚Äù app. This is your starting point for all AR analytics.
  2. Then, take Look at the ‚ÄúAR Aging Analysis‚Äù tile and take note of the percentage shown (e.g., 15.7%).
  3. Next is to Scroll down to view aging bucket values for example:
  • Overdue receivables 1.73‚ÄØM (based on your screenshot)
  • Total receivables 11.0‚ÄØM (based on your screenshot)
  1. You can also carry out a manual calculation using the SAP formula as stated below:

Net Overdue % = Overdue Amount √∑ Total Receivables √ó 100

                            = 1.73 √∑ 11.0 √ó 100             

                            = 15.7%

 

How you can Calculate % of AR Collected

To get total AR open amount (as of start of month), the first step is to:

  • Open the ‚ÄúAccounts Receivable Overview‚Äù app
  • Note total open receivables that is displayed.

The go ahead to get collected AR for the period

  • You will need to use the ‚ÄúCash Flow Analyzer‚Äù or ‚ÄúIncoming Payments‚Äù app
  • Make sure to ‚Äúfilter by date range‚Äù for example you can filter for the current month if this applies.
  • Take note of the ‚ÄúTotal collected‚Äù data displayed

The following manual calculation displayed below provides you the steps required:

AR Collection % = Collected Amount √∑ Total Starting AR √ó 100

                = 2.5 √∑ 11.0 √ó 100

                = 22.7%

Note that this gives you the collection performance rate for that period.

 

Optionally, you can ‚ÄúOverdue Receivables Today‚Äù App. This app provides more insights into how you can manage overdue aging structure, by customer, region, or sales area. You can also export the data into Excel for more detailed reconciliation.

Please note the following for a successful solution:

  • The AR Aging percentage only considers open and overdue items cleared items are excluded.
  • The percentages are dynamic and reflect real-time system data.

The following page provides further information.

SAP Help: Accounts Receivable Overview

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Incorrect transfer TR to the production system if the...
entry.content:
Hello,

 

In the standard ChaRM and STMS  configuration , once a transport request is imported in the pre-production, STMS will do a "selection for import" in the production system (it will be added automatically to the import queue of the production system). So, if you have a ChaRM periodic import job running at 6 a.m. for production system import, the transport request will be imported into production. This is normal and expected.

 

To prevent this, ChaRM has got a configuration called "Status-dependent import strategy". You can read more about it in SAP KBA 2453216 , which has links to the configuration help pages for status dependent import. If you run into any issues, you may search the SAP Knowledge Base with the keyword /TMWFLOW/VC_IMPS, and you will find the corrections for known issues, hints about particular errors, etc.

 

Best regards,

 

Miguel Ari√±o

In FTR_Edit, I clicked on Give Notice/Terminate and selected the date when I want the transaction to end. I clicked on Settle, and now the remaining items in cash flow are Flagged for Fixing. I proceeded to Fix Pay and Post flows. All the items in cash flow are now Posting Carried out.

I went back to click on Give Notice/Terminate again, but this error message showed up.

‚ÄÉ

I tried to Settle again but I got this error message as well.


I came to the understanding that if a transaction is terminated, the activity status should be "Completed" or "Contract Settled". I am unsure how to proceed in order for this to be fully terminated.

entry.title: Community Feedback List - Recent activity
entry.content:
Reported as a discussion based on The SAP Community Feedback List is now live! - SAP Community

I am pretty sure I am not the first one reporting this by anyway..
The recent activity on SAP Community is too confusing. It shows the "most recent" content based on any type of activity. In the end, we have an unsorted list of activity because if someone comment on a question from 2007 saying "I have the same issue", this very old question will be moved to the top of the list on the recent activity. Even worst, it will not show the recent content itself but it will always show the question or the blog post.

 

My suggestion: comments and answers should not be part of the recent activity. 

cc @AnnePetteroe

entry.title: AMS vs XSUAA: The Future of Authentication and Authorization in SAP BTP
entry.content:
Why Switch from XSUAA to IAS + AMS in SAP BTP?

SAP is modernizing its identity and access management by moving away from XSUAA and recommending the newer combination of IAS (Identity Authentication Service) and AMS (Authorization Management Service). Here's what that means and why it matters.

The Old Way: XSUAA

XSUAA (eXtended Services for User Authentication and Authorization) was SAP's go-to service in BTP for:

- Authentication: Verifying the user's identity.

- Authorization: Checking what the user is allowed to do.

But XSUAA had some limitations:

- Roles and user access had to be set up separately for each app and subaccount.

- Tokens were issued per app, leading to inconsistent formats.

- User onboarding had to be repeated across apps.

- This became messy in enterprise landscapes with many apps.

The New Way: IAS + AMS

SAP now recommends using IAS for authentication and AMS for authorization. These services are part of SAP Cloud Identity Services and offer a centralized, scalable approach.

What IAS Does (Authentication)

- Acts as a central identity provider.

- Supports SSO, MFA, and integration with corporate systems like Azure AD or Okta.

- Issues a single identity token valid across apps and subaccounts.

What AMS Does (Authorization)

- Central place to define and manage roles and policies.

- Replaces the need for xs-security.json in every app.

- Integrates with CAP applications using the @SAP/ams plugin.

- Injects authorization details directly into the IAS token.

Key Advantages of IAS + AMS

Comparison Table

What Changes in Your App?

In xs-app.json:

- Change authenticationType to "ias".

- Remove scope definitions ‚Äî they‚Äôre handled centrally now.

How Deployment Works Now

To use AMS and IAS:

- Set up IAS: As your BTP subaccount's identity provider.

- Set up AMS: Create an instance and define policies.

- Bind both to your CAP app.

- Configure App Router: To redirect to IAS for login.

- Use Identity Directory: Define user groups and connect them to roles in AMS.

Final Thoughts

Switching from XSUAA to IAS + AMS simplifies security on SAP BTP:

- No more duplicate role definitions.

- Seamless login and authorization across environments.

- Aligned with SAP‚Äôs long-term vision.

Start using IAS + AMS now to keep your applications modern, secure, and future-ready.

References:

btp-developer-guide-cap/documentation/xsuaa-to-ams at main ¬∑ SAP-samples/btp-developer-guide-cap ¬∑ GitHub, Enabling Authorization Policies in SAP Cloud Ident... - SAP Community

entry.title: Incorrect scale level picked during final settlement for quantity-based rebate condition
entry.content:
Hello,

In a condition contract using condition type RES1 with Base Scale & condition table 163, we‚Äôve maintained quantity-based scales for two materials: 

Material A: 1 PC = 1%, 5 PC = 2%, 10 PC = 3%

Material B: 20 PC = 2%, 30 PC = 4%, 40 PC = 6%

An invoice contains 7 PC of Material A & 32 PC of Material B. However, during  final settlement, the system incorrectly applies 3% for Material A & 6% for Material B. instead of the expected 2% & 4% resp.

This issue does not occur when only one condition record exists in the contract. Why is the system picking incorrect scale values when multiple condition records are maintained?

Thank you

entry.title: Re: ML81N IDoc
entry.content:
Hello @RGALLARDO 

You have written: "From an external system, they are going to send the data to register the acceptance of the ML81N service in SAP R3." Thus, I guess you are asking about an inbound IDoc scenario, where an external system sends a message to SAP in order to post a service entry sheet.

@Lakshmipathi has already provided the BAPI_ENTRYSHEET_CREATE function to post service entry sheets. You can generate a corresponding IDoc using ALE-BAPI interface, transaction BDBG - SAP Help Maintaining the BAPI-ALE Interface Once the interface is generate you can use the IDoc and the ALE message type in your integration scenario.

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Re: Automation Pilot : Start & Stop HANA Instance, Schedule Executions on Automation Pilot
entry.content:
Hi @gaetanodf_acn,

This is a provided command - you can directly trigger it or embed it in a command of your own. It does not make sense to clone it as you can't modify it's internals. 

What I assume you want todo, apart from directly triggering this automation, is to create a new command of your own (in a catalog of your own), which has this one as one of its executors.You can go to the 'My Catalogs' tab and use the GenAI features or GUI there to achieve this. 

Hope this helps!

entry.title: Community Feedback List - Accuracy of Profile information
entry.content:
Reported as a discussion based on The SAP Community Feedback List is now live! - SAP Community

I have a few reasons to believe that the profile information (posts, solutions, kudos given, kudos received) is either not real time or not accurate in all cases. I'd some clarification on this topic.

@AnnePetteroe  I am using your profile as an example which most likely is good and mentioning you here so you can become aware of this topic.

Now see these others:

1) User with 1 post but none is displayed.

2) User created in 2015 with 6 posts but only 2 are visible in the posts list. only 9 Kudos since 2015? It seems off... 

Those are not isolated examples. I follow many SAP community heavy users where those numbers are very low or the number of items does not really match what is visible on their profile so I have the following questions:

 

  1. Does the number of posts / solutions consider the old SDN, SCN? My guess: no
  2. Does the kudos given / received consider the old SDN, SCN? My guess: no but maybe the kudos were created in the last migration. Didn't we have likes before?
  3. Are number of posts / solutions based on real time information? My guess: Yes
  4. Are kudos given / received based on real time information? My guess: Yes
  5. Are deleted questions removed from the profile but not from the numbers? My guess: no
  6. Were all questions/posts/blogs migrated to the current SAP Community?  My guess: no
  7. Finally, are those numbers considering all universal account users linked with your profile? My only suspicious for many old users having almost an empty profile is if they have created a new account (maybe linked with the same universal id)
  8. How does SAP Community track the 'online' status?

Thanks in advance,

entry.title: Re: Build and Run Multi-Tenant SaaS Solutions on the SAP BTP
entry.content:
Update July 2025

We updated the Partner Reference Application ‚ÄúPoetry Slam Manager‚Äù with the following changes and enhancements:

  • API for remote integrations: We enhanced the sample app by an additional service without draft handling. With this example we separate the service definitions tailored for web apps (with draft handling), and service definitions for remote integrations and cross-stack extensions scenarios, for example solutions that are composed of SAP S/4HANA Cloud developer extensibility and BTP-based applications.
  • We enhanced the tutorials to configure the integration with SAP Business One by a guideline to setup the connection to the B1 service layer using principal propagation. In result B1 user authorizations are applied in back-channel communications as well.
  • For the purpose of TCO optimization and to optimize the utilization of minimum order quantities, we enhanced the tutorial for Observability explaining how to setup and use a shared SAP Cloud Logging instance across multiple applications and subaccounts.

entry.title: Re: How to Write a blog
entry.content:
Deploying a CAPM (Cloud Application Programming Model) project to SAP BTP (Business Technology Platform) involves several clear steps. CAPM is SAP‚Äôs opinionated framework for building full-stack applications, and BTP offers multiple services (like HANA, XSUAA, destinations, etc.) for deploying and running those applications.

Here‚Äôs a structured step-by-step guide to deploy a CAPM project to SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry environment:

 Prerequisites

  • Node.js (v16 or higher)

  • CDS CLI: npm i -g @SAP/cds

  • SAP BTP CLI (btp CLI)

  • Cloud Foundry CLI (cf)

  • Access to an SAP BTP subaccount with Cloud Foundry enabled

  • MTA plugin for Cloud Foundry: cf install-plugin multiapps

  • Project created with cds init my-capm-app

entry.title: Re: CDS View I_GLACCOUNTHIERARCHY is empty in SAP S/4HANA...
entry.content:
I am not a specialist on those topics but I have a recent finding on this Manage Global Hiearchy app which I don't know if it was like that in OB58. Basically you can either change a hierarchy on dev, test or prod. Of course, some authorization is needed for that but depending on system settings the app will prompt a customizing request.

For instance, when you manage stuff in dev so you can transport your changes. But it's still possible to directly change something in test or prod and in this scenario the system will not ask for a request.

Actually at this very moment I have a ticket opened with SAP because we realized that the change log is not transportable. So you only see the changes on the system where those changes are made.

But anyway, I know that somehow those new hierarchies are more relevant for reporting purposes and it is not only a technical migration to other tables. Semantically they are different from the past and there are many SAP notes about those differences.

entry.title: Re: Manage Customer Line Item Tile
entry.content:
Hi @12345678901 

Thanks for sharing the screenshots and your questions.

I reviewed your setup and I'll clarify how SAP S/4HANA Cloud calculates DSO and what the various filters in the Manage Customer Line Items app mean.

It is important to note that the ‚ÄúDays Sales Outstanding‚Äù KPI is derived using data from the Manage Customer Line Items App. This is visible her  How the DSO Is Calculated

 

Below are the functionalities available in the filter and its status meaning:

  1. Open Items ‚Üí to calculate "Open Receivables"

This filter pulls only unpaid, open customer invoice items for the specified or desired key date. These are used as the numerator of the DSO calculation.

  1. All Items ‚Üí to calculate "Sales"

This setting includes all sales related line items, either paid or unpaid which is used to compute total sales during the period. In contrast to ‚ÄúOpen Items‚Äù this is used as the denominator in DSO formula.

  1. Sales‚ÄëRelated Item filter

This distinguishes invoice-related postings from other line items. Only those flagged as sales-related are counted in the total sales base for DSO.

Below is a calculation of the DSO

DSO = (Open Receivables √∑ Sales) √ó Days in Period

Here is a real calculation example:
If open receivables = 10M and total sales = 60M over a 62-day period:
DSO = (10 √∑ 60) √ó 62 = approx. 10.3 days

Below are reasons why i recommend using the filter:

  • Using Open Items ensures you're only measuring customer obligations still outstanding.
  • Using All Items with Sales-Related captures actual invoice amounts, not clearing entries, memos, or payments.
  • This aligns with how SAP aggregates data for the AR Aging Analysis and DSO tiles in the overview dashboard.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Ready-to-Use Template Dashboards: Integrating SAP Cloud ALM Data into SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Hello and welcome! In this blog, I'm excited to share the progress I've made on creating easy-to-use dashboards with SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) using data from SAP Cloud ALM (CALM) Health Monitoring (HM) and Real User Monitoring (RUM). Let's see how these dashboards can turn data into helpful insights.

The Project Overview
In today's dynamic business landscape, making informed decisions requires access to accurate and timely data. That's precisely what my dashboards aim to achieve: providing a user-friendly interface to visualize and analyze SAP system data.
The project entails building two dashboards that provide comprehensive insights into system health and user interactions. We can import these pre-built templates into your SAC environment, connect them with your CALM data, and provide you with immediate access to system and service information, saving you the effort of creating dashboards from scratch.

Dashboard Highlights

  • Health Analytics Dashboard
    Built for S/4HANA systems, this dashboard provides insights into system health and performance, helping identify issues through data on uptime and resource utilization.
    Here the details of the dimensions available through the API: Health Monitoring Analytics API | SAP Help Portal

      

  • Real User Analytics Dashboard
    This dashboard tracks user interactions. It reveals activity patterns, identifies bottlenecks, and highlights areas for improvement in your digital environment.
    Here the details of the dimensions available through the API: Real User Monitoring Requests Type Analytics API | SAP Help Portal


Key Benefits

  • Plug-and-Play Templates:
    We can import these dashboards into your SAC tenant and connect them with your existing CALM setup. This service removes the need for you to design dashboards on your own and offers an immediate starting point for analysis.
  • Customization Flexibility:
    While the templates offer a comprehensive initial setup, users have the freedom to modify and expand upon these dashboards to better align with their specific needs. This adaptability ensures that the dashboards remain relevant and scalable.
  • Historical Data Analysis:
    The dashboards can display data for specific points in time‚Äîsuch as days or hours‚Äîas well as over a selected period, but depending on the chart. The configuration I would recommend would be to set up daily updates, gathering the data of the previous day, every morning. Then this setup will continuously enriches your model with new data.

Conclusion
This SAP Analytics Cloud project exemplifies the powerful intersection of data and technology. By providing these ready-to-use dashboards, I aim to facilitate a starting point for users seeking to utilize their SAP Cloud ALM data effectively. The dashboards not only simplify the analytical journey but act as a catalyst for data-driven decision-making.
If there are other metrics or areas you believe could benefit from similar dashboards, I'd love to hear your ideas. Your suggestions could guide future dashboard developments  üôÇ


Don't hesitate to reach out to your SAP representative to see how SAP can support you regarding these ready-to-use dashboards.


Thank you for taking the time to read my post.

entry.title: Re: Upload Project Budget successfully, There's no budget...
entry.content:
Ensure the project has a budget profile assigned. For that, go to OPS9 to view or maintain budget profiles. Confirm that the profile includes availability control settings.
Even if planned data is imported, the budget must be released. For that, go to CJ32 to release the budget for the project or WBS element. Without release, the system treats the budget as unavailable.
Mismatch in currency settings can cause false budget errors. So ensure the budget currency matches the posting currency. Have a look at SAP Note 906975 for currency translation issues

Check this SAP Help  documentation for more details

entry.title: Re: Recommended Approach for Check Printing in SAP S/4HAN...
entry.content:
Hi,

There is a standard process for check printing. After automatic payments, you can access the check in the Output Items in the Manage Automatic Payments app. To display the detailed check info, navigate to the Manage Outgoing Checks app. See Outgoing Checks .

You configure the output of checks in the BRF+ framework. For more information, see Configuring the Output of Outgoing Checks | SAP Help Portal.

For positive pay files: After you create a payment run, you can extract the checks in it and export the result using SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity. You can use the app Create Positive Pay Files: Create Positive Pay Files | SAP Help Portal. You can also create positive pay files using a job: Creation of Positive Pay Files | SAP Help Portal   

Regarding your question about remittance data formatted within the check layout: If you have payment advice output, the check info will be included. If you don't have payment advice output, the remittance data can be output in a check. See the KBA 2801192 - Check rules for populating Check Remittance or payment advice - SAP for Me for more information.

Hope this helps.

Kind regards,

Sharon

entry.content:

Thanks very much for your reply. I'm working with Dan on this issue.

You suggested that we leave the approval reason blank in our SD_APM_SET_APPROVAL_REASON BADI implementation, but when we do that, the system removes the 'Released' status. We think this is because the workflow's start condition is based on a specific Approval Reason ID value ('001'). If that value is blank, the approval relevancy is removed.

entry.title: Credit Check in Sales order but credit data were delete
entry.content:
• Credit management sales order is credit checked after the credit management master data is deleted for the business partner.
  • Unable to prevent credit checks for the business partner despite deletion of credit management master data.
  • How to prevent credit check to be carried out for the business partner.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Credit Check in Sales order but credit data were delete
entry.content:
1. Assign a Custom Check Rule Without Credit Check Steps

  • Create a custom check rule (e.g., Z1) that does not include any check steps.

  • Assign this rule to the BP using the Manage Credit Accounts app.

  • This ensures that no credit check is performed for the BP during sales order processing.

2. Use a Risk Class Without Credit Check Configuration

  • Assign a risk class to the BP which is not configured for credit checks in the configuration activity:
    Define Automatic Credit Control (SSCUI ID: 101518).

  • If the risk class is not associated with any credit control checks, the system will not perform a credit check for BPs assigned with that class.

3. Set a Very High Credit Limit

  • If neither of the above options fits your process, you can assign a very high credit limit to the BP.
  • This ensures that the credit exposure never exceeds the credit limit, preventing credit blocks during order processing.

entry.title: Re: SAP SF Time Tracking - Time Valuation Count Events on...
entry.content:
Hi,

Check the valuation Method that is chosen for this time Valuation.

The valuation method defines the basis on which the input time data is valuated, for example, if it is calculated on a daily or weekly basis.

Select Valuate Per Day if you want time valuation to be carried out on a daily basis.

Select Valuate Whole Sheet if you want time valuation done on a weekly basis.

Select Valuate Up To Today if you want time valuation done for the period up to and including the current date.

Try with "Valuate per day"

Best Regards,

Jelena

entry.title: Re: Regular Expressions (RegEx) in Modern ABAP
entry.content:
@msiblyb that is one way.

 

DATA(lv_text) = '7F1D19F178871FE09BA4E47266CF37A6NDARXXXXX00 WEST'.
DATA(lv_match) = abap_false.

FIND REGEX '^([0-9A-F]{32}).*WEST$' IN lv_text IGNORING CASE.
IF sy-subrc = 0.
  lv_match = abap_true.
ENDIF.

WRITE: / 'Match:', lv_match.

Hint: Chat-GPT is good for this kind of issue.

Hint 2: It's better asking it a separate question if you are struggling with this instead of reviving from 2021 with a question as a comment.
